column4: hey, i tried adding the ppa for the latest OOo 3.2 and i am getting errors while doing the update, any idea how i can set it right?
could you start by postbining the errors?

i get a few ignores for the OOo and then a 404 error. I removed the ppa from the software sources list but even now i get a few Ign for Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net karmic/main Translation-en_US and similar
http://paste.ubuntu.com/377257/
huh, I don't know why it would do Ign
even I cant figure that out
you're trying to install the latest OO.o?
well i was, i found a link that said to add the ppa and try but it dint work. and those 404 errors came up which i could clear out after removing the OOo ppa.
would you know how to install the latest OOo via terminal so that I can get updates
I wouldn't want to install from source either -- but I haven't tried getting the latest one, only the one in the standard repos
any particular reason why you want the lastest one?
why would you not want to install the latest from the source? I am unable to open MS Office's .***x format files
installing from source can be difficult -- though it's often very easy. Have you tried opening those files up in the standard Open Office?
Yes I can on my windows box
what about the version of open office in the standard repositories?
or is there a way i can uninstall the current OOo and reinstall?
just a  sec
to uninstall Open Office and re install it -- the first thing to do would be open Synaptic, and search for Open Office, then remove the ones that are selected
I need to reboot into ubuntu, brb
but how would i know which all i need to install, i have tried looking at the list but its huge
okay np
you can also use quotes around the path
